item.content:encoded: For years, I‚Äôve seen journalists cover the ‚Äúmanosphere‚Äù as a random group of friends who show up on each other‚Äôs podcasts. Today, I and other reporters published a story firmly showing how these YouTubers boost each other and politicians while steering male culture to the right
item.author: Ashley Carman

item.content:encoded: Leaked documents from the Trump admin show that ICE wants four new detention centers with 10,000 beds each, and fourteen smaller facilities with 700-1,000 beds each. That would likely mean tens of billions in taxpayer funds sent to private prison companies. They are salivating.
item.author: Aaron Reichlin-Melnick

item.content:encoded: Cleaned out my Twitter archive and moving discussions over to Bluesky. You'll still see me posting articles and occasional comments here, but if you're looking for discussion and interaction (and Lily), we're over there.

item.content:encoded: 75% of immigrant farm workers didn‚Äôt show up yesterday in Bakersfield because of fears of ICE raids under the new presidency. America‚Äôs rural and agricultural regions will be the hardest hit from Trump‚Äôs immigration policies. Food prices are going to skyrocket.

item.content:encoded: Republicans wanted to fast track confirmation of a controversial CIA nominee. I blocked it. Because right now, after their unconscionable endorsement of Trump's Jan 6 pardons - including the most violent rioters - we cannot let them pretend they care about national security.

item.content:encoded: ACOSTA: Do you agree with Trump's decision to pardon violent people? REP. BURCHETT: If they were truly violent, no. But I don't know that? ACOSTA: What do you mean you don't know? We're showing the footage right now.
item.author: Aaron Rupar

item.content:encoded: Unpopular opinion on size of govt: we don't have a bloated government (it's actually quite lean). We have bloated laws, which gives all kinds of random powers over us to bureaucrats. It's a design problem.
item.author: Sandeep Pravin Parekh

item.content:encoded: AOC: "I want folks at home to look at what members of Congress are invested in private prisons companies, and look at the votes on this bill. It is atrocious that people are lining their pockets with private prison profits in the name of a horrific tragedy."
